required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Human Apotransferrin in Patients With β-thalassemia Intermedia

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the trial is to study the effect of apotransferrin administration in patients suffering from β-thalassemia intermedia in order to restore the erythropoiesis as reflected by enhanced haemoglobin levels or reduced transfusion dependency.

primary_outcome.description: Change of haemoglobin level and/or or change of number of RBC units transfused/week

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in serum iron
Change from baseline in change plasma levels of advanced glycation end products
Change from baseline in reticulocyte count
Change from baseline in erythropoietin levels

secondary_outcome.time_frame: predose and postdose 5 minutes, 2 hours and 1, 4, 7, 14 days
secondary_outcome.description: Ctrough calculated from serum transferrin levels

secondary_outcome.time_frame: predose and postdose 5 minutes, 2 hours and 1, 4, 7, 14 days
secondary_outcome.description: Cmin calculated from serum transferrin levels

secondary_outcome.time_frame: predose and postdose 5 minutes, 2 hours and 1, 4, 7, 14 days
secondary_outcome.description: tmax calculated from serum transferrin levels

secondary_outcome.time_frame: predose and postdose 5 minutes, 2 hours and 1, 4, 7, 14 days
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax calculated from serum transferrin levels

secondary_outcome.time_frame: predose and postdose 5 minutes, 2 hours and 1, 4, 7, 14 days
secondary_outcome.description: AUCτ calculated from serum transferrin levels
Ctrough calculated from serum transferrin levels

arm_group.description: Patients will receive one intravenous loading dose of human apotransferrin on Day -1 followed by the maintenance dose every two weeks from Day 0 onwards for 14 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Non-transfusion dependent β-thalassemia intermedia, defined as patients with microcytic anaemia in combination with an elevated HbA2 (>2.5%) and a haemoglobin of <6.2 mmol/L, or transfusion dependent β-thalassemia treated with a regular transfusion schedule.
- Age above≥ 17 years.
- Adequate renal and hepatic function tests
- WHO performance 0, 1 or 2.
- Signed informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known with allergic reactions against human plasma or plasma products.
- Concurrent severe and/or uncontrolled medical condition (e.g. uncontrolled diabetes, infection, hypertension, pulmonary disease).
- Cardiac dysfunction as defined by: myocardial infarction within the last 6 months of study entry, unstable angina, or unstable cardiac arrhythmias.
- Pregnant or lactating females.
- Known with IgA deficiency with anti-IgA antibodies
